content.description: A researcher claims that budding yeast are able to survive in different environments because they produce enzymes that allow them to use different molecules as sources of matter and energy.
content.question: Which of the following statements best helps justify the researcherâ€™s claim by providing a relevant example?

choices.label: Yeast cells produce protein kinases, which are enzymes that catalyze the transfer of phosphate groups from <math alttext="A T P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ATP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> to protein substrates.

Yeast cells produce <math alttext="D N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> polymerases, which are enzymes that catalyze the conversion of free nucleotides into strands of <math alttext="D N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.
Yeast cells produce invertase, which is an enzyme that catalyzes the conversion of the disaccharide sucrose into glucose and fructose.
Yeast cells produce catalase, which is an enzyme that catalyzes the conversion of hydrogen peroxide into water and oxygen gas.

content.answer: Yeast cells produce invertase, which is an enzyme that catalyzes the conversion of the disaccharide sucrose into glucose and fructose.

skill.text: 6.C: Provide reasoning to justify a claim by connecting evidence to biological theories.
